page.title: 13SHOPPING
page.content: Although Tomintoul is a small village, the shopping facilities are very good. There are four main shops, two of which have been in the same family for a number of generations. These shops not only sell food and general house-hold and fancy goods but also cater for the many tourists who visit ,ur village in the summer and during the ski-ing season. John Ross's "Spar", Iain Birnie's "Mace" shops and Campbell's Corner Store all have off-licences. The fourth shop is a general store, newsagent and post office combined. There is also a Butcher's Shop in the village. Many people travel to Elgin or Inverness for major shopping expeditions.
